# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution using Julia DataFrames package, which allows us to work with data frames:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyymm")
    return df
end
```

You can call this function like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 3)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will return a new data frame with an additional column `ym` that contains the year and month of each date.
